query:
INSERT INTO fca_blog_posts (title, slug, excerpt, content, author, publishDate, featured, category, tags, views, likes, shares)
VALUES 
(
  'How Faith Transforms Athletic Performance',
  'how-faith-transforms-athletic-performance',
  'Discover how top athletes use their faith as a foundation for excellence and how you can apply these principles to your own athletic journey.',
  'Faith and athletics have been intertwined throughout history. From Eric Liddell refusing to run on Sunday at the 1924 Olympics to Tim Tebow kneeling in prayer after touchdowns, athletes have long used their faith as a source of strength and inspiration.\n\nBut how exactly does faith transform athletic performance? Lets explore the science and spirituality behind this powerful connection.\n\nMental Clarity and Focus: Faith provides athletes with a sense of purpose beyond winning. This perspective reduces performance anxiety and allows athletes to compete with freedom.\n\nResilience in Adversity: Every athlete faces setbacks - injuries, losses, slumps. Faith provides a framework for understanding suffering and finding meaning in difficult times.\n\nTeam Unity: Shared faith creates bonds that go deeper than shared goals. Teams that pray together often display remarkable chemistry on the field.',
  'Chad A. Dozier',
  DATE_SUB(CURDATE(), INTERVAL 5 DAY),
  'yes',
  'Faith & Sports',
  'faith,performance,mental game,spirituality',
  234, 56, 23
),
(
  'Building a Team on Faith',
  'building-a-team-on-faith',
  'The power of shared beliefs in creating championship culture and how faith-based teams consistently outperform expectations.',
  'Championship teams share something special - a bond that goes beyond talent and strategy. Many of the most successful teams in sports history have been built on a foundation of shared faith.\n\nFrom the Miracle on Ice 1980 US Hockey team to recent championship squads, faith has been a common thread among teams that achieve greatness against the odds.\n\nCreating a Faith-Based Team Culture means building an environment where players are valued as people, not just performers. Character is developed alongside skills. Struggles are shared and supported. Success is celebrated with gratitude. Failure is met with grace.\n\nPractical Steps for Coaches: Model the values you want to see. Create space for spiritual growth. Emphasize character in recruiting. Address the whole person, not just the athlete.',
  'Chad A. Dozier',
  DATE_SUB(CURDATE(), INTERVAL 10 DAY),
  'no',
  'Leadership',
  'teamwork,culture,coaching,leadership',
  189, 42, 18
),
(
  'The Mental Game: Faith as Your Competitive Edge',
  'mental-game-faith-competitive-edge',
  'Learn how faith-based mental training can give you an unshakeable mindset in competition.',
  'Sports psychology has long recognized the importance of mental preparation. But what many dont realize is that faith provides the ultimate mental framework for athletic excellence.\n\nWhen your identity is rooted in something greater than your performance, you compete with freedom. You can take risks because failure doesnt define you. You can handle pressure because your worth isnt on the line.\n\nPractical Faith-Based Mental Training: Start each day with scripture meditation. Develop a pre-competition prayer routine. Use biblical affirmations during competition. Practice gratitude regardless of outcomes.\n\nRemember: You are more than an athlete. Your value comes from being a child of God, not from your stats or trophies.',
  'Chad A. Dozier',
  DATE_SUB(CURDATE(), INTERVAL 15 DAY),
  'no',
  'Mental Game',
  'mental,psychology,mindset,faith',
  312, 78, 34
)
